result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean Michael Ashton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sean Michael Ashton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sean Michael Ashton was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Designer Drugs (>3-10g) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "E" Felony], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(hm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-IMPOSED/STAYED.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant to have a mental health assessment and treatment.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected of use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Defendant to provide a DNA Sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 1, 3 and 4.
Court authorizes Probation may be transferred to Michigan.
Court notes 173 days credit against ultimate sentence.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: A. McKinley.  DF ATTY: Joshua Hargrove DF: Sean Michael Ashton appeared. Case called at 9:49. Court reviews file. PSI has been completed. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement, DE is not feeling well. Court gives the DE the option to continue on another day.  DE wants to continue. Crt orders: 7 years prison. 3 years initial confinement 4 years extended supervision I/S. 6 months conditional time to be served in the St. Croix County Jail with credit for 173 days against any ultimate sentence.
4 yrs probation with conditions:
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your 
   system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA aassessment and treatment.
-  DE to have mental health assessment and treatment. 
- Not to associate with persons who use, manufacture or deliver, or envolvement in drugs except
  in a treatment setting. 
-  Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Costs for Count 2 to be paid through probation. 
- ff $501.00
- DE to provide DNA sample
- Court authorizes probation transferred to Michigan. 
- DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
- DE is eligible for the substance Abuses Program. 
- Court revokes bail.
By Agent Lynner w/cover letter.  SRN reviewed. sf

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA: Amber L Hahn DF ATTY: Joshua Hargrove DF:  Sean Michael Ashton appeared from jail. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2 removing the repeater in 14CF338. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Ex. #1 O/R.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 removing the repeater in 14CF338. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1, 3 and 4 in 14CF338. Court orders a PSI and Compass. Bond revoked. DE remanded to SCSO.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.
